Package org.zaproxy.zap.spider

Class SpiderParam

java.lang.Object
org.parosproxy.paros.common.AbstractParam
org.zaproxy.zap.spider.SpiderParam
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
@Deprecated public class SpiderParam extends AbstractParam
Deprecated.
(2.12.0) See the spider add-on in zap-extensions instead.
The SpiderParam wraps all the parameters that are given to the spider.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    SpiderParam.HandleParametersOption
    Deprecated.
    This option is used to define how the parameters are used when checking if an URI was already visited.

      public boolean isPostForm()

    • setHandleParameters

      public void setHandleParameters(SpiderParam.HandleParametersOption handleParametersVisited)
      Deprecated.
      Sets the how the spider handles parameters when checking URIs visited.
      Parameters:
      handleParametersVisited - the new handle parameters visited value

    • setHandleParameters

      public void setHandleParameters(String handleParametersVisited)
      Deprecated.
      Sets the how the spider handles parameters when checking URIs visited.

      The provided parameter is, in this case, a String which is cast to the proper value. Possible values are: "USE_ALL", "IGNORE_VALUE", "IGNORE_COMPLETELY".

      Parameters:
      handleParametersVisited - the new handle parameters visited value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given parameter is not a value of HandleParametersOption.

    • isHandleODataParametersVisited

      public boolean isHandleODataParametersVisited()

      Check if the spider should take into account OData-specific parameters (i.e : resource identifiers) in order to identify already visited URL
      Returns:
      true, for handling OData parameters

    • setAcceptCookies

      public void setAcceptCookies(boolean acceptCookies)
      Deprecated.
      Sets whether or not a spider process should accept cookies while spidering.

      For example, this might control whether or not the Spider uses the same session throughout a spidering process.

      Notes:

      • This option has low priority, the Spider will respect other (global) options related to the HTTP state. This option is ignored if, for example, a User was set or the option Enable (Global) HTTP State is enabled.
      • The cookies are not shared between spider processes, each process has its own cookie jar.
      Parameters:
      acceptCookies - true if the spider should accept cookies, false otherwise.
      Since:
      2.7.0
      See Also:
      • isAcceptCookies()

    • isAcceptCookies

      public boolean isAcceptCookies()
      Deprecated.
      Tells whether or not a spider process should accept cookies while spidering.

      For example, this might control whether or not the Spider uses the same session throughout a spidering process.

      Returns:
      true if the spider should accept cookies, false otherwise.
      Since:
      2.7.0
      See Also:
      • setAcceptCookies(boolean)

    • setMaxParseSizeBytes

      public void setMaxParseSizeBytes(int maxParseSizeBytes)
      Deprecated.
      Sets the maximum size, in bytes, that a response might have to be parsed.

      This allows the spider to skip big responses/files.

      Parameters:
      maxParseSizeBytes - the maximum size, in bytes, that a response might have to be parsed.
      Since:
      2.7.0
      See Also:
      • getMaxParseSizeBytes()
